skillTree.localised_description: The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Wyverns are occasionally mistaken for dragons but there is little nobility of spirit in these winged beasts, making them kindred spirits for their Orc riders.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Tunnel bosses are Greenskins who are good at shoutin’ and hollerin’ at mobs when underground, where space and sight is an issue.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield, making sure the boyz are focused on the carnage.
You can’t trust ‘im. E’s a little bit woaah, a little bit Waaagh! Ya know? Well dodgy.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The magical warpaint that protects da boyz is always greatly appreciated on an Orcish battle line.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Orc infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Orc Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Red paint would make the boars run faster; this war paint will give them some protection.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Orc Boar units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Orc Boar units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: While locating enough paint for such a job isn't easy, no one can deny the results are suitably impressive!

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% for Trolls, Giant, Arachnarok Spider, Colossal Squig and Rogue Idol units
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Trolls, Giant, Arachnarok Spider, Colossal Squig and Rogue Idol units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: While an Orc Shaman will primarily dance around chanting their magic, never forget that they are Greenskins, and Orcs at that. Get too close and they'll still rip your arms off!
The Savage Orcs are a highly superstitious bunch, and will always dance to their insane Shamans' twisted, insidious beat, whenever they hear it.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Savage Orc and Savage Orc Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Savage Orc and Savage Orc Rider units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +5 for Savage Orc and Savage Orc Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Orc Shamans often chant incoherently while dancing around camp, much to the discomfort of da boyz.
The bigger the Waaagh!, the bigger the spells, and the greater the Shaman's power.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Big Waaagh! spells
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Gaze of Mork"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Gaze of Mork Upgraded"

Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Brain Bursta"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Brain Bursta Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Brain Bursta Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Fists of Gork"

target_if: Not on or below a platform

Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Foot of Gork"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Orcs may be stronger, but Goblins are smarter, nastier, and better-er.

skillTree.localised_description: Greenskin cavalry can be devastating if the myriad mounts can behave. Getting a big stick and maybe a "carrot" in the form of an orange-painted gobbo is the answer!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss is one with "da boyz", egging the lads on to greater feats and to hit bigga stuff with their choppas.

skillTree.localised_description: Ridin’ on chariots means ya can be even more fighty, an' even more killy!

skillTree.localised_description: Even bigga than a Black Orc, an' not bad at killin’ too!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss realises the power of "flyin’ fings” and so invests a few teef in making sure his war machines can fling fings really far and really high!

Ammunition: +10% for Goblin Rock Lobber and Doom Diver Catapult units

skillTree.localised_description: The sneakiest and stabbiest gobbos are just as dangerous as the largest, fiercest Orcs.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for all Goblin, Pump Wagon, Night Goblin and Squig Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘Ardest of da ‘Ard. Don’t mess, gottit?

Armour: +12 for Orc units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Orc units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Orc units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: It’s one fing to be big, but quite anuva to be strong as well!

skillTree.localised_description: Nuffin' smashes harder than a rock fallin' from da sky, except mebbe da Bad Moon, if it were to fall.

Ammunition: +20% for Goblin Rock Lobber and Doom Diver Catapult units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A wise Boss knows how to lure the enemy into places where they can be ambushed or trapped with mobs that skulk in the tunnels below.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
These iron-hard gits are particularly tough and gnarly Greenskins, who - even if wounded - will be up and ready to fight before too long.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Occasionally an Orc will come along who is more "kunning" than the rest. He quickly rises in ranks as his plans end in victory.
A Boss that has the loyalty of the mobs means he doesn’t have to worry so much about "da boring stuff" like tents and bedding, as they’ll fight for him no matter what.
Being green meanz ya really mean.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Someday he's gonna be a Boss. Can you believe someday we'll work for 'im?"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Black Orcs and Big 'Uns units
	(own army)

Recruitment cost: -25% for Big 'Uns and Black Orc units
	(own army)

Recruit rank: +1 for Big 'Uns and Black Orc units
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: When you're clearly betterer than all the uvvers you need to shout the loudest, so everybody else knows you're the betterest.
"Dat a 'shroom in yer pouch? Give it! Give it to me!"

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for Goblin and Night Goblin units

backgroundSkills.localised_description: You can't keep a good 'danca' down, especially when those drums start bangin'!

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: When a Warboss needs someone to talk, he calls on this "Boy wiv da extra pointy sticks".
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

nodes.localised_description: The more this general follows Da Plan, the better they get at using Gorbad's Tactics.

effects.description: Infinite duration for Da Plan Tactics
